name: stevieray's style #1 for FF4
description: I like the look of the standard FF4 toolbar buttons, and decided to restyle the UI to match them.
additional_info:
Notes:
Got rid of some of the dropmarkers... I figured anybody using Stylish doesn't need little pointy-clicky things.
Changed the app menu button... didn't like the standard one.
Designed to run with tabs under the nav bar so the active tab "connects" and the inactive ones don't.

This is my first attempt at writing a style... or any script at all, in fact. If you spot errors, or better ways of doing things, please let me know. All constructive criticism welcome!


Edit: Added new text color/shadow to tabs and urlbar.
Edit: Changed the scroll bars.
Edit: Restyled the bookmarks sidebar.
Edit: Changed history sidebar panel.
Edit: Added Personal Toolbar and Menubar styles.

This style was originally conceived to have an embedded image as its background in the main window. Unfortunately, said image is large... too large to include in the main style. It is 1+ mb large, as a matter of fact. To get the intended background, please go to the link and copy the file as a new style. Sorry for the hassle! http://www.mediafire.com/file/p29f22ssbpb2n9q/background%20for%20style%20%231.txt

Thanks to adamned.age - H.adam (EXurban) for the texture image! http://www.flickr.com/photos/hanne_exurban/sets/72157622112724335/

Note: Still can't get Tab Mix Plus buttons to play nice. And when the Menubar option is selected, the background image disappears from the Titlebar. Feh.
